intro: Siphocampylus dependens var. undulatus, commonly known as the wavy beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Its flowers are tubular with two lips, and the plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
